page.title: 05 OUR FARM VISIT
page.content:
OUR FARM VISIT.
One Thursday in June we walked across the fields to{Golden Acre Farm.}Mr. Pitcher, the farmer,told us he only has 20 acres so it is officially called a smallholding.(A farm is 50 acres.) We didn't see many animals as his chickens are over at{Andridge {Farm,}which he rents. During the summer he uses all his fields for{hay_making}& raises{beef {cattle}during the winter months,when they are feeding on the hay. We were able to see five horses though,one of which is a Gypsy horse. His horses are shoed by Mr Aslett, our farrier.He also showed us his three tractors and farming implements.One of them was an old 1943 Ferguson TE20.
